messages.subject: Re: my opinion re: this group
messages.msgSnippet: Just curious: has anyone looked at the Topica email list structure? http://lists.topica.com/ I haven t gotten any mail from my topica lists in a while, but I
messages.messageBody:
Just curious: has anyone looked at the Topica email list structure? http://lists.topica.com/

I haven't gotten any mail from my topica lists in a while, but I remember them being fairly easy to use... something to look at & think about... (I like yahoogroups best in digest format... I like what y'all have said about the google groups web format, but don't like their digest format at all: can't email people from the digests if you want to because there's no email information, though I kind of like that the topics are bunched together...)

Just my 2 cents! :)

> > I'd like to stay as we are but if we move then I'm going with you
> > all to google (is that where we'd go???)
>
>
> Would be, but I'll leave it here. That's fine.



Cheers,

Jessica

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] my opinion re: this group

messages.messageBody:
On Apr 15, 2006, at 5:16 PM, SquishyMommy1@... wrote:

> But i am in a group that moved to google
> and well over half the people have left because of the move.


If you're talking about UnschoolingDiscussion, that count and
assessment aren't true.

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] my opinion re: this group
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/15/2006 3:11:30 AM Central Daylight Time, kimlewismark@optusnet.com.au writes: I m  newish too and my opinions are probably not that
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/15/2006 3:11:30 AM Central Daylight Time,
kimlewismark@... writes:


I'm newish too and my opinions are probably not that relevant. I don't
really know what the differences would be (have been lazy and not looked up
relevant things you've sited) so my vote probably doesn't count now anyway but I
like it here. I like the group dynamics. I'd like to stay as we are but if we
move then I'm going with you all to google (is that where we'd go???)

Sorry I'm abit duh....


I am fine with moving to Google. But i am in a group that moved to google
and well over half the people have left because of the move. Just something
to think about. But i am for whatever.

~Alyssa
Slightly crunchy, unschooling Mom to Landen(2 1/2) and Gage(6 months)

"Work like you don't need the money, love like you've never been hurt, and
dance like you do when nobody's watching."

messages.subject: my opinion re: this group
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Sandra, I m newish too and my opinions are probably not that relevant. I don t really know what the differences would be (have been lazy and not looked up
messages.messageBody:
Hi Sandra,

I'm newish too and my opinions are probably not that relevant. I don't really know what the differences would be (have been lazy and not looked up relevant things you've sited) so my vote probably doesn't count now anyway but I like it here. I like the group dynamics. I'd like to stay as we are but if we move then I'm going with you all to google (is that where we'd go???)

Sorry I'm abit duh....

kim
